heading: clark's remarks
subheading: jim clark didn’t get to be so rich by mincing words. from the pages of the new new thing: clark on the healtheon business model: "we want to empower the doctors and the patients and get all the other assholes out of the way. except for us. one asshole in the middle." clark, three hours […]
author: wired staff
text: jim clark didn't get to be so rich by mincing words. from the pages of  the new new thing:clark on the healtheon business model: "we want to empower the doctors and the patients and get all the other assholes out of the way. except for us. one asshole in the middle."clark, three hours into the maiden transatlantic voyage of his cyberyacht, hyperion: "i don't know why the fuck i came on this. it's going to be boring as hell. ... get across this ocean in a straight line."clark on cutting a healtheon deal with microsoft: "when i formed netscape, i thought about sleeping with the enemy. now i know i should have done it. i've gone over to the dark side."must readhot tongue actionpower exchangenaughty bitsstupid net lawsthe lewis and clark expeditionclark's remarkstired/wiredpeoplejargon watchthe wages of simpac-ratinstant replaypc and a blow-drygimme redmondraw data
